sentences.sContent: Her illness was caused mainly by stress.
sentences.sCn: 她的病主要是由精神压力引起的。

sentences.sContent: The workforce is mainly made up of women.
I don’t go out much, mainly because I have to look after the kids.
sentences.sCn: 我不大出去，主要是因为我得照看孩子们。

sentences.sContent: Increased sales during the summer were mainly due to tourism.
sentences.sCn: 夏季销售额增加主要是由旅游业带动的。

sentences.sContent: We talked about various things – work, mainly.
sentences.sCn: 我们谈了各种各样的事情——主要是谈工作。

sentences.sContent: ...What is the speaker mainly talking about...
...What is the news report mainly about...
...There are mainly two reasons for my choice...
...Recycling helps the environment mainly by saving energy...
...What is mainly discussed in the talk...
...The physical act of crying is mainly one of breathing in air...
...the giant panda mainly lives in the forests of Southwest China...
...but nowadays it is mainly functioning as decoration...
...We mainly deal with large volume buyers from western countries and our products have been well received...

words.tran: 主要的，最重要的；全力的
主要部分，要点；体力；总管道
支柱；中流砥柱；主要的依靠；主桅支索
主要动力；（钟表）主发条；主要原因；主要动机

trans.tranOther: used to mention the main part or cause of something, the main reason for something etc
